CHARLATAN: A mountebank, someone who addresses crowds in the street; (especially), an itinerant seller of medicines or drugs.
FAKE: Something which is not genuine, or is presented fraudulently.
HOAX: Anything deliberately intended to deceive or trick.
PHONY: A person who assumes an identity or quality other than their own.
QUACK: The sound made by a duck.
SHAM: A fake; an imitation that purports to be genuine.
